attributes.action: Prostate screening for men over 45
attributes.background: 1 in 8 men will have prostrate cancer a simple blood test would help detect early rising psa levels
attributes.additional_details: From personal experience of having prostrate cancer on discovery of very low level psa I was sent for biopsy resulting in discovery of 2 tumours which meant I had to have a prostatectomy

attributes.action: Refuse any request for another Scottish independence referendum before May 2020
attributes.background: The constitution is a reserved matter and therefore no consent should be given to another Scottish referendum before May 2020.
attributes.additional_details: The Scotland Act 1998 states that the constitution is a reserved matter therefore consent has to be given by Westminster before any future Scottish independence referendum could take place.

attributes.action: Introduce stronger laws on anti-Islamism.
attributes.background: Muslims in Britain are facing increased hostility, prejudice and discrimination. Stop the negative portrayal of a whole religion and terming 'terrorism' with Islam in the media. Ordinary Muslims do not need to suffer for the actions of a minority.
attributes.additional_details: In the light of recent terrorist attacks; including the Paris and Orlando shootings, the whole religion of Islam has been constantly blamed in the media for the actions of criminals. There is nothing Islamic about committing any forms of abuses. Help stop bigotry in all the media and our institutions so that ordinary Muslims can live normal lives in Britain.

attributes.action: Bring back compulsory Sexual Education lessons in Secondary Schools in the UK
attributes.background: In the early hours of the 12th June 2016, a horrific, homophobic-fuelled attack happened in a gay club in Orlando. In response to this tragedy, I am proposing that we bring back compulsory Sexual Education Lessons, with a focus on LGBTQIA+ and Feminism in order to help eradicate homophobia.
attributes.additional_details: As a 15 year old, I can tell you levels of homophobia in Secondary Schools are high, and actual Sexual Education lessons are no longer compulsory. The school has to do something, but actual lessons are no longer compulsory. I believe that homophobia in secondary schools is a direct result of this. I am LGBTQ+, and I always see this prejudice and discrimination in school and on social media and it is sickening. Now more than ever, the UK needs to be united, and attempt to eradicate homophobia.

attributes.action: Stop hospitals putting DNAR orders onto patients records against their will .
attributes.background: My father was admitted to the Queen Elizabeth Hospital in Birmingham on Monday with heart failure and fluid overload. My father has a living will that he wants life to be maintained. The hospital has put a DNAR onto my father's records, my father has objected but the objection has been ignored.
attributes.additional_details:
The hospital will not remove the DNAR.  Are the patient’s wishes no longer of paramount importance? You have to ask what's the point of a living will? The consultant says the decision is due to Dad’s age & the fact he has heart failure which will only get worse.    
How many people are going into hospital & have DNAR put on their records against their wishes? This practice must be stopped, people's wishes are not being respected.  It's like euthanasia in disguise.

attributes.action: Ban the primate pet trade in the UK
attributes.background: More than 5000 primates including cappuchins and squirrel monkeys, are currently being kept privately as pets in the UK. Being subject to abhorrent conditions, unable to meet their basic physical, social and psychological needs, the primates are forced to live a life they'd rather not live.
attributes.additional_details:
Many of these monkeys fortunately end up in sanctuaries such as Wild Futures UK, set up to ensure their protection and meet the needs that had been withheld from them. But even then, many of these monkeys can never be returned to the wild they were taken from due to their inability to fit in with wild monkeys. The psychological damage many primates face  means they could never survive in the wild.

Join me and various UK organisations in calling for a complete ban on the primate pet trade

attributes.action: For the UK to hold a General Election within 12 months of the EU referendum
attributes.background:
The resigning Prime Minister, Rt Hon. David Cameron, held a referendum for the people to vote on leaving or remaining in the EU.
With the result in favour of the "Leave" campaign he announced his intention to leave his post, paving the way for an unelected Prime Minister after less than 2 years.
attributes.additional_details:
Following the massive turnout in the referendum & the decision of their elected leader to leave his post, the people of the United Kingdom, deserve to elect a new Prime Minister. 
This decision should not be left to  the Conservative party as the country now finds itself in entirely new circumstances and any new PM chosen by them, would not be properly recognised by the public.
A General Election should be held within 12 months of the result of the E.U. Referendum (No later than 1st July 2017).

attributes.action: Change the law to ensure the safety of children crossing roads near schools
attributes.background:
Make it compulsory for local councils to be held accountable for ensuring that children can cross busy, dangerous roads safely when walking to school.
Local councils currently do not have to provide a solution for children crossing busy roads and it is at their discretion.
attributes.additional_details: On gypsy lane in Nuneaton, 2 crossing patrol staff members have unfortunately been unable to fulfil their roles due to extremely sad circumstances. As a result children are having to cross an incredibly busy, dangerous road, resulting in children nearly being hit at speed by dangerous drivers. Due to the current legal requirements, the police nor the council have to provide safe passage which is putting children at serious risk. The duty of care is non existent and this needs to change.

attributes.action: Limit paying out Child Benefit to the first two children only.
attributes.background:
As the law stands, Child Benefit can be paid out to people who have children. This may or may not be the parents.
The payment for the first child is currently £20.70
For each additional child, it is £13.70 per child.
We believe that Child Benefit should be limited to the first two children only.
attributes.additional_details:
We believe that benefits are in the gift of the Government.
As the law currently stands, Child Benefit is paid at the rate of £20.70 for the first child and £13.70 for each additional child.
We believe that this needs to change and that the Government should legislate to limit the payout of Child Benefit to the first two children only.
This would reduce the benefits bill and the burden on the taxpayers.
People who wish to have more than two children should not expect the state to pay for them.

attributes.action: Parliament to make Companies in UK offer Royal mail rates and courier rates.
attributes.background: Homes in the Highlands and Islands of Scotland and in Northern Ireland are normally only offered one rate. This results in much higher costs to these areas OR BEING REFUSED ANY DELIVERY AT ALL. Around 69% online dealers do not offer delivery by Royal Mail, which is the same wherever it is in UK
attributes.additional_details: A Postcode Penalty survey found 63% of online retailers charge extra delivery for certain parts of the UK and 34% said delivery would take longer for those who live on islands. Royal Mail charges the same no matter where you are located in the UK. The Government must create a law that  that ensures that, at least, those customers in these areas mentioned above are offered courier rates and Royal mail rates. THEY ARE  ALL PART OF UK and should be entitled to get the cheapest delivery service.

attributes.action: Give a fine to parents if their children are persistent bullies.
attributes.background: I am asking for this petition to be signed so parents realise if they do not prevent their children from bullying other children persistently they would face a fine.
attributes.additional_details: As an aunty to my niece, who was bullied on many occasions, mainly from the same girl, I'm sure I speak for many parents who have found it devastating to watch someone go through this ordeal. This not only affects them, it actually changes them as a person. So would really be greatful for this to come into effect.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for motorised vehicles to park or wait in cycle lanes.
attributes.background:
Cycle lanes can help increase confidence for cyclist with a designated part of the road, either by having it separate from roads of with road markings.
When vehicles park or wait in a cycle lane, it not only makes the cycle lane pointless, it actually increases the risks to cyclists.
attributes.additional_details:
A cycle lane gives a cyclist a little more confidence, especially for newer cyclists.
Cycle lanes that have vehicles in them are not only a waste of money and resources, but dangerous to cyclist and moving vehicles. 
The cyclist has to go further into the road in an area where a cycle lane was deemed to be needed.
What is the point in having cycle lanes that are unusage by cyclists because they are full of parked cars?

attributes.action: Stop air strikes in Syria and Iraq.
attributes.background: The UK's involvement in military action endangers the lives of innocent civilians in the Middle East and here in Britain where we lay ourselves open to terrorist action. The millions spent on war could be better used to come to the aid of the desperate refugees displaced by conflict.
attributes.additional_details: So called Islamic State are clearly making life hell for the people in the territories they have occupied but by dropping bombs we are only adding to their misery. We are falling into the narrative that Isis has written for us. How can we possibly condemn terrorism whilst murdering innocent people ourselves? It is nonsensical.

attributes.action: Meet full cost of Student Nurse training from National Health Contributions.
attributes.background: There is a recognised shortage of nurses in this country.  There exists the possibility that Brexit will have a further impact.  Nurses are essential to the health of our nation.  It must be an imperative of government to implement a future-proof plan to ensure the ready supply of qualified nurses.
attributes.additional_details: Any discussions previously held about the future funding of nurse training were, no doubt, pre-Brexit.  An Act of Parliament that serves to ensure the recruitment of talented people into nursing must be considered an essential and positive step.  The reliance on young people (and others) to borrow in order to fund their nursing care training renders this much-needed recruitment uncertain, and therefore at risk from external forces.  The State as priniciple employer must ensure adequate funding.

attributes.action: To not close heart departments especially for babies and children.
attributes.background: They are very important and as parent of a heart baby who died knows how important they are, it's more common than people realise, those who haven't been there don't understand but let's put it this way how would you cope with loosing a baby/child with an unexpected heart problem with no where to go
attributes.additional_details: I no lots of heart babies/children that with out these hospitals or departments wouldn't be here now. You are being selfish and need to think these things through I can't thank the hospital we were under enough for what they did. Just think about it first, what if the boot was on the other foot

attributes.action: Make politicians accountable for being Clear, Fair and Not misleading.
attributes.background: The ‘clear, fair and not misleading’ requirement is used in financial services, where companies are accountable for the statements they make about their products to customers. Statements made by politicians may influence the entire country - and should at least meet this same threshold.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition is in response to the misrepresentations, mistruths and lies that the electorate were fed by politicians in the EU referendum. 

Immediate admissions have been made that information in the campaigns was misleading (such as Farage stating that the £350m NHS claim was a ‘mistake’ / and Liam Fox confirming that the correct number is ‘a net £10bln’ or ‘more like £160m’, etc.) 

The UK electorate has a right to expect politicians to be clear, fair and not misleading in all statements.

attributes.action: Adopt a zero tolerance approach to acts of racism, in the wake of the referendum
attributes.background: Since the EU referendum, there have been numerous accounts of racism and xenophobia, where people who are in the UK legally are being abused, assaulted and/or told to "go home". A zero tolerance stance is required to show that racism and xenophobia has no place in the UK, whether in the EU or not.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/entry/eu-referendum-racism_uk_576fe161e4b08d2c56396075

attributes.action: Repeal Scotland Act 1998 and 2016 Amendments and dissolve Holyrood
attributes.background: On 26th June First Minister Nicola Sturgeon threatened to veto UK succession from the EU despite the country voting by over 1.2 million votes to leave. Such action is in contravention to democratic will. Westminster should reverse Scottish devolution to prevent the SNP's constitutional overreach

attributes.action: Enforce equal and nondiscriminatory insurance policies for young drivers.
attributes.background: Young drivers aged 18+ face extremely unfair and ridiculous insurance fees for car insurance. These vary from £10,000 to well over £50,000, often costing 4/5 times the price of a car itself. How is it i am mature enough to have two jobs whilst attending college, but not drive a car affordably.
attributes.additional_details: Insurance companies are exploiting young drivers at rates which many can not afford. This behaviour goes completely against the whole notion of equality which Britain prides itself upon and discriminates heavily against the young and disabled preventing them from having equal opportunities in life as those who are older.

attributes.action: More funding in the NHS for prosthetic legs
attributes.background: I have been an amputee since i was 3. All the while i have been having problems with my prosthetic leg not because of the ability of staff but the lack of funding. Why should there be a price on someone's mobility? I struggle with my leg and many others do too, more funding means better legs.
attributes.additional_details: With the lack of funding the availability of resources are minimal, i get sores and ulcers and my leg gives way alot. Many others struggle with them as well and its a shame that we cant live our lives to the full, we cannot possibly afford private legs with better equipment and the large variety of things we can get to make the leg fit and feel better.  Please sign this petition as it will help me and many others to be independent.

attributes.action: Fund university expenditure for the production of radiolabelled Vitamin B12
attributes.background:
People with Vitamin B12 deficiency caused by Pernicious Anaemia have problems with diagnosis because the available tests are inaccurate.

The Schilling Test can accurately diagnose the cause of Vitamin B12 but is no longer performed because nobody makes the radiolabeled cobalt required.
attributes.additional_details:
Vitamin B12 blood tests are inaccurate. The test for the antibodies responsible for PA is only accurate 50% of the time.

The Schilling Test requires radiolabelled cobalt. A government-sponsored source could make it possible to reinstate this test.



Reference for inaccuracy of tests - 
http://www.bcshguidelines.com/documents/BCSH_Cobalamin_and_Folate_Guidelines_(2).docx.pdf
Reference for Schilling Test - 
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Schilling_test

attributes.action: We demand an immediate increase in Government aid for the famine in Yemen
attributes.background: Children are starving to death in Yemen. Millions of people are malnourished & this is quickly becoming one of the most catastrophic famines of the 21st Century. A million & a half children are currently starving to death in a famine partly caused by damage inflicted by UK-provided weaponry.
attributes.additional_details:
Human Right's Watch Report detailing use of UK-made weaponry: https://www.hrw.org/news/2016/07/11/saudi-coalition-airstrikes-target-civilian-factories-yemen

7 Million people near starvation - Huffington Post: http://www.huffingtonpost.com/william-lambers/yemen-the-forgotten-famin_b_10864754.html

The role of the West in Yemen's war - The Economist: http://www.economist.com/news/middle-east-africa/21702651-lucrative-devastating-war-role-west-saudi-arabiau2019s-war

attributes.action: Make A.P.D. (Auditory Processing Disorder) a registered disability.
attributes.background: My husbands best friend has A.P.D. and has been told that because it is not a recognised disability he has to settle for hearing aids to help yet he has the condition which does not warrant the the use of those. It is a processing disorder not a hearing impairment.

attributes.action: Instigate a 2nd EU referendum, honestly campaigned and to include 16-17 yr olds
attributes.background:
EU Membership is too important to be decided by a vote based on inaccurate campaign claims and which excluded 16-17yr olds.
The EU referendum result is not legally binding. Cameron decided that the UK should be bound by it but has subsequently resigned. His decision can & should be rescinded.
attributes.additional_details:
•	The percentage difference between Leave and Remain was not great enough to trigger such a momentous course of action - 48% voted Remain 
•	16 & 17yr olds were not included - their future is at stake & their votes should be counted
•	Voters may have been swayed by false information - eg the Leave campaigners have acknowledged their NHS claims were inaccurate. All campaign claims should be regulated by the Advertising Standards Authority to ensure accuracy and honesty for both parties.

attributes.action: Build social housing for wounded soldiers
attributes.background: I would like the government to find the money to build council houses for wounded soldier's.

attributes.action: Get water companies to remove water meters and stop profiteering from customers.
attributes.background:
Water bills have increased substantially over the last few years.Water companies say that its fairer system.we disagree as hard working families are paying more and  water companies are making bigger profits for their shareholders.
Its unjust and government should stop this profiteering.
attributes.additional_details: Talk to families and check the profit margins of companies responsible for providing water

attributes.action: Make the minimum hourly wage for residential & domicilary care workers £10phr.
attributes.background: I'm shocked and appalled at the hourly rate of pay offered by care homes. Most start at the current minimum wage of £7.20phr, it's known some pay as little as £5.00phr. The work is incredibly demanding mentally, physically and emotionally, & one which vulnerable adults rely entirely on their carers.
attributes.additional_details:
Over the years there have been a number of newspaper articles chronicling the poor wages on offer to care workers. Such as in the Independent, guardian & on the bbc websites.
By paying a more realistic and professional hourly rate:
- The industry can and will attract better quality carers who will feel valued and see the job as a profession.
- Those being cared for will be getting the best carers. 
- It would help reduce the number of families claiming Tax credits, to supplement their income.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for a company to require only women to wear makeup at work
attributes.background: Following Nicola Thorp's petition on high heels, it should also be illegal to require women to wear makeup at work, except in circumstances where it genuinely is required and a man would also be required to do so (e.g. theatrical productions, but there is no excuse for offices).
attributes.additional_details: Makeup is expensive (and cannot normally be claimed back as a work expense), time consuming (you won't normally get paid for that time) and can damage skin. Contrary to sexist stereotypes not all women have been wearing it daily since their teens, and some would actually be unable to do a professional-looking makeup job at all. This should not stop someone getting a job. Note that most schools actually ban children, including older teens, from wearing it.

attributes.action: All British citizens shall have the right to vote in national referendums.
attributes.background: All British citizens must have the right to participate in referendums that are national in extent. The rule that bars citizens from voting in constituency elections if they have lived outside the country for more than 15 years shall not apply to voting in national referendums.
attributes.additional_details: All British citizens are affected by the outcome of national referendums; therefore, all British citizens must have the right to vote in said referendums, no matter where in the world they live and no matter how long they have lived outside the country. No national referendum shall be conducted until this matter is resolved and all loyal subjects are granted this fundamental democratic right.

attributes.action: Introduce a procedure where the people can call for a vote of "no confidence"
attributes.background: In a democracy I believe that if we are able to elect our leader, then we should be able to raise the question of "no confidence" in our elected leader.

attributes.action: Introduce Scandinavian transparency of Personal income and Taxation to the UK.
attributes.background:
In the wake of the Panama papers revelations it is surely  time to Campaign for Scandinavian style transparency of personal income and Taxation.
In Norway, Everyone's Income Is Public—and So Is Tax Paid
The UK must introduce this to shame evaders and close loopholes and discourage tax evasion.
attributes.additional_details:
If taxes paid were publicized, then this would do more than just shame tax evaders. Even in cases where people are legally exploiting the tax laws to their advantage, it would help to create a conversation about the tax code itself. For example, if we learn of some obscure tax credit allows wealthier individuals to consistently avoid paying a major portion of their income taxes, then we could debate whether or not it's good policy. 
Transparency is the best form of disinfectant on this issue.

attributes.action: Legalise Cannabis for Holi. A Hindu practice dating to 1500BC.
attributes.background:
In 2011, there were some 806,199 Hindus living in England.
Cannabis has a holy origin through Lord Shiva. In India, intake of the substance peaks on Holi and Maha Shivrati (Hindu festivals). The legal status of cannabis limits religious freedom and prevents full and proper worship.
attributes.additional_details:
Cannabis is mentioned as a medicinal, magical and sacred plant in the Atharva Veda (dated 2000 - 1400 B.C.) It also calls hemp one of the five kingdoms of herbs which releases us from anxiety and refers to hemp as a "source of happiness", "joy-giver" and "liberator". It is used by millions to cleanse themselves of sin and to please Lord Shiva.
http://www.theatlantic.com/international/archive/2014/03/indias-high-holiday/284448/
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Entheogenic_use_of_cannabis

attributes.action:
ban cycle racing on the public roads
And make cyclist use the cycle paths
attributes.background: I was driving the other day just come round the bend and there was 3 of them next to eachover taking up the road and could not pass its so dangerous
attributes.additional_details:
ban cycle racing on the public roads
I would like the government to ban cycle racing on public roads. On our busy streets their is no place for sports cycle racing, its highly dangerous with cyclists often racing three abreast and not moving in on narrow roads to allow faster traffic to pass. clubs should rent tracks to race on cars and motorbikes have to , cyclists pay no road tax,have no insurance etc, pleasure cycling and commuting should be encouraged on cycle paths only but racing banned

attributes.action: The NHS have to provide scanning machines for people who are obese .
attributes.background: I have just recently lost my son who was obese. On arrival at the hospital it was imperative that he had a scan but was unable to get 1 and apparently no where round about had 1that was suitable for his weight  .

attributes.action: Reduce 6 weeks hols to 5, let kids chose their 6th week.
attributes.background: Reduce  6 weeks hols to 5 and let children choose a 6th week to go on holiday during term time as long as it doesn't coincide with exams or tests.
attributes.additional_details: Holiday companies are charging extortionate prices during school holidays and we are not allowed to keep children off school during term time, this would be an ideal solution.

attributes.action: Judicial inquiry into Leave and Remain campaigns with repeat EU Referendum
attributes.background: We request: (i) a full independent judicial inquiry into the conduct of all parties involved with both official, and other, campaigns; and (ii) that the EU Referendum is repeated so that the UK public is able to vote on the basis of fair and balanced, rather than misleading, campaign statements.
attributes.additional_details: The recent EU Referendum was characterised by false and misleading statements from both Leave, Remain and other parties.

attributes.action: Grant London the powers to negotiate its own terms with the European Union.
attributes.background:
London is a global capital of culture and business. This partly thanks to the European Common Market and free movement of labour within Europe. London has voted overwhelmingly to stay within the EU, whilst England as a whole hasn't. 
London should be free to negotiate its own terms with the EU.

attributes.action: Include tattoo, body piercings & hair colour in the anti-discrimination act.
attributes.background: In an age that wants us to be accepting of unconventional values, it should be law for employers to refuse you an interview or a job for creative physical expression.
attributes.additional_details: Tattoos, body piercings and diverse hair colours are an act of freedom and self expression in a linear society that wants us to conform to physical norm. They do not affect the level of service we provide to our work sectors and every individual should be able to physically express themselves however they want no matter what job they do. It should be law as part of the anti-discrimination act to be accepting towards those with any tattoos on the body, any hair colour and any piercings.

attributes.action: Make rear facing law till 2
attributes.background: As research shows its 10x safer for a child to be rear facing up to 2 sometimes 4 unfortunately a lot of people are to quick to put their babies into forward facing at 9+ months which in an accident can have devastating consequences! Whereas rear facing children will more than likely have a bruise

attributes.action: The DfT should urgently plan and fund a mass transit system for Leeds
attributes.background: Leeds is the largest city in western Europe without a mass transit system. Leeds has the third worst air quality in the UK and has recently been warned over exceeding World Health Organisation's air quality limits.
attributes.additional_details: Today it as been announced that central government aren't going to back a mass transit system that, however flawed it was, would have gone some way to improving these issues. These plans were ten years and £60m in the making. Please  sign this petition if you believe that local MPs, councillors and the DfT should be compelled to produce a plan and find the funding for an immediate transport intervention for Leeds and the city region.

attributes.action: Make sure refugees and immigrants are vaccinated to the same standard as uk
attributes.background: We are now seeing cases of bugs and diseases that's not been an issue for years in UK. Our children are starting to suffer for longer periods and more often. As a parent I'm getting concerned about about my children's health and have a 3 year old that's constantly getting ill
attributes.additional_details: As the country is allowing refugees and immigrants from various locations it's time to think of our children's health welfare and theirs. We need to ensure our children don't pick up various bugs that have become less common in the last 20 years or so. Please support us to petition the government to ensure all new British citizens are given vaccinations up to the level that we all are

attributes.action: Change the way Statutory Redundancy Payments are calculated please
attributes.background:
The current SRP is calculated by using your present salary only and this needs to change.  Working people that previously held full time roles within their company cannot use these years at the higher salary rate to calculate their final payment.  
A fair adjustment mechanism needs to be created.
attributes.additional_details:
Mum works part time for the last five years after giving birth but, had previously worked full time in the same role for ten years.  
The company decides to restructure and her role is made redundant.
Mum can only claim 15 years service at the part time salary.  
Result, greatly reduced final payment.
The full time salary should be used to calculate the 10 years working full time hours and part time salary to calculate the remaining 5 years.
Result, fair SRP using company records.

attributes.action: Stronger penalties for bullying, harassment and hate crime in the workplace.
attributes.background:
All of the above costs the UK economy loss of monies. It adversely impacts on the victim's career, physical and mental health and personal life. 

As per NHS choices one of the causes of suicide is bullying.
attributes.additional_details: The victim's voice is often lost. There is a general disbelief and isolation when the victim raises concerns through in house grievance processes. It is " institutional failure " when the victim is treated with a lack of humanity and lack of dignity at work. Hence, the victim needs to be supported through the government, parliament and petition. It benefits the UK economy and the victim both.

attributes.action: Stop the sale of cruel halal meat in the UK
attributes.background: Stop the cruel slaughter of innocent animals for halal meat. Stop the sale of halal meat in UK.

attributes.action: Make employers offer bereavement leave following the death of a pet
attributes.background: The loss of a pet is a traumatic experience with research showing that the death of a companion animal is "just as devastating as the loss of a human significant other" (Planchon et al, 2002: 94). Yet Employment rights do not currently recognise the loss of a pet in terms of bereavement leave.
attributes.additional_details: Academic studies repeatedly show that companion animal guardians (pet owners) consider their companion animals as family members (Voith, 1985). Consequently the grief following a pet's death carries the same psychological and physical problems that occur when a significant human dies (Gerwolls & Labott, 1994). Employment rights recognise the need for a period of bereavement leave following the death of a human dependent but no formalised equivalent is afforded following the loss of a pet.

attributes.action: Extend NHS staff lunch breaks from 30 minutes to 1 hour, 30 minutes isn't enough
attributes.background: As you know NHS staff work under immense stress and pressure, saving lives on a daily basis. Staff working in these conditions should be given adequate time to get away from the department and relieve themselves of stress. Working under intense pressure without adequate rest can lead to fatigue.
attributes.additional_details: Working in stressful environments without adequate time to relax can lead to stress, fatigue and ultimately making mistakes which can put lives at risk, we believe staff should have enough time to get away from the department and unwind. 30 minutes is nowhere near enough time to leave the department, pick up lunch and then have time to eat before being late back for shift. We propose that lunch breaks should be extended to 1 hour or 45 minutes at the least to ensure staff have time to eat,relax.

attributes.action: Organise a Brexit referendum for 15 to 17 year olds
attributes.background: I am a 15 year old girl who feels that her future has been ignored by those voting in the Brexit referendum. I believe we can show the government that the outcome could have been very different if our views had been taken into account.

attributes.action: Call on the Government to Trigger Article 50 and repeal EC Act 1972.
attributes.background: We live in a Democracy and the EU Referendum result should be honoured by the Government.  Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty must be triggered and the European Communities Act 1972 should be repealed.

attributes.action: Stop Criminalizing/Banning U.K Drivers For Smoking Cannabis Days Before Driving.
attributes.background: Cannabis Users Are Being Driven Off Of The U.K Roads In Staggering Numbers Due To Smoking Cannabis Days Before Driving Why ?
attributes.additional_details:
The Governments Own Drug Advisor's State That Cannabis Can Take Up To 10 Days To Leave The System With Other Sources Saying Up To 67 Days In Chronic Users  
https://www.drugabuse.gov/publications/marijuana-facts-teens/want-to-know-more-some-faqs-about-marijuana

While The Nhs Say It Can Show For Weeks 
https://www.drugabuse.gov/publications/marijuana-facts-teens/want-to-know-more-some-faqs-about-marijuana

And As The High From Cannabis Last No Longer Then A Few Hours How Is This Fair.

attributes.action: Outlaw mobile safety cameras or prove they improve road safety
attributes.background: Mobile safety cameras or mobile speed cameras, they appear in places with no warnings to motorists, fine if you're not speeding but prove that they are improving road safety! Where I live accidents are minimal we have no speed cameras just the van that shows up and no warning signs before you see it
attributes.additional_details: It's about time a proper debate was had about these! If they are just to target those who pay no attention place a sign before it can target a motorist let them know there is a police operation in progress! Show is proof that they actually improve road safety and reduce accidents in areas they are used! Modern technology on cars does though that has been proven time and time again! Raise speed limits of you are to continue to use these cash cows or give plausible warnings that they are in action
